title.raw: 《荊燕世家》 Houses of Jing and Yan

sentences.zh: 荊王劉賈者，諸劉，不知其何屬初起時。

translations.text: King Jing Liu Jia was one of the various Liu clansmen; no one knows which branch he belonged to during the initial uprising.

sentences.zh: 漢王元年，還定三秦，劉賈為將軍，定塞地，從東擊項籍。

translations.text: In the first year of Han King, after pacifying the Three Qins, Liu Jia served as a general, secured the border regions, and followed east to attack Xiang Yu.

King Jing Liu Jia was one of the various Liu clansmen; no one knows which branch he belonged to during the initial uprising. In the first year of Han King, after pacifying the Three Qins, Liu Jia served as a general, secured the border regions, and followed east to attack Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 漢四年，漢王之敗成皋，北渡河，得張耳、韓信軍，軍修武，深溝高壘，使劉賈將二萬人，騎數百，渡白馬津入楚地，燒其積聚，以破其業，無以給項王軍食。

translations.text: In Han year 4, when the Han King was defeated at Chenggao and crossed north over the river, obtaining the armies of Zhang Er and Han Xin, he stationed at Xiuwu with deep moats and high ramparts, commanding Liu Jia to lead 20,000 men and several hundred cavalry across the Baima Ford into Chu territory, burning their grain stores to disrupt their livelihoods and prevent them from supplying Xiang Yu's army with food.

sentences.zh: 已而楚兵擊劉賈，賈輒壁不肯與戰，而與彭越相保。

translations.text: Soon after, Chu troops attacked Liu Jia, but Jia entrenched himself and refused battle, instead holding out with Peng Yue.

In Han year 4, when the Han King was defeated at Chenggao and crossed north over the river, obtaining the armies of Zhang Er and Han Xin, he stationed at Xiuwu with deep moats and high ramparts, commanding Liu Jia to lead 20,000 men and several hundred cavalry across the Baima Ford into Chu territory, burning their grain stores to disrupt their livelihoods and prevent them from supplying Xiang Yu's army with food. Soon after, Chu troops attacked Liu Jia, but Jia entrenched himself and refused battle, instead holding out with Peng Yue.

sentences.zh: 漢五年，漢王追項籍至固陵，使劉賈南渡淮圍壽春。

translations.text: In Han year 5, the Han King pursued Xiang Yu to Gulang, commanding Liu Jia to cross south over the Huai and besiege Shouchun.

sentences.zh: 還至，使人閒招楚大司馬周殷。

translations.text: On the return, he sent agents to secretly recruit Chu's Grand Marshal Zhou Yin.

sentences.zh: 周殷反楚，佐劉賈舉九江，迎武王黥布兵，皆會垓下，共擊項籍。

translations.text: Zhou Yin defected from Chu and assisted Liu Jia in capturing Jiujiang, welcoming King Wu Ying Bu's troops, all gathering at Gaixia to jointly attack Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 漢王因使劉賈將九江兵，與太尉盧綰西南擊臨江王共尉。

translations.text: The Han King then commanded Liu Jia to lead the Jiujiang troops southwest with Grand Marshal Lu Wan to attack King Linjiang Gong Wei.

sentences.zh: 共尉已死，以臨江為南郡。

translations.text: Gong Wei had already died, so Linjiang was made into Nanguo commandery.

In Han year 5, the Han King pursued Xiang Yu to Gulang, commanding Liu Jia to cross south over the Huai and besiege Shouchun. On the return, he sent agents to secretly recruit Chu's Grand Marshal Zhou Yin. Zhou Yin defected from Chu and assisted Liu Jia in capturing Jiujiang, welcoming King Wu Ying Bu's troops, all gathering at Gaixia to jointly attack Xiang Yu. The Han King then commanded Liu Jia to lead the Jiujiang troops southwest with Grand Marshal Lu Wan to attack King Linjiang Gong Wei. Gong Wei had already died, so Linjiang was made into Nanguo commandery.

sentences.zh: 漢六年春，會諸侯於陳，廢楚王信，囚之，分其地為二國。

translations.text: In spring of Han year 6, he assembled the feudal lords at Chen, deposed King Chu Xin, imprisoned him, and divided his territory into two kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 當是時也，高祖子幼，昆弟少，又不賢，欲王同姓以鎮天下，乃詔曰：「將軍劉賈有功，及擇子弟可以為王者。」

translations.text: At this time, Gaozu's sons were young, his brothers few, and moreover not worthy, so he wished to enfeoff kings from the same surname to stabilize the realm. He issued an edict saying: 'General Liu Jia has merit, and I will select clansmen who can be made kings.'

sentences.zh: 群臣皆曰：「立劉賈為荊王，王淮東五十二城；

translations.text: All the ministers said: 'Establish Liu Jia as King of Jing, ruling over 52 cities east of the Huai;

sentences.zh: 高祖弟交為楚王，王淮西三十六城。」

translations.text: Gaozu's younger brother Jiao as King of Chu, ruling over 36 cities west of the Huai.'

sentences.zh: 因立子肥為齊王。

translations.text: He then established his son Fei as King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 始王昆弟劉氏也。

translations.text: This began the enfeoffment of brothers from the Liu clan.

In spring of Han year 6, he assembled the feudal lords at Chen, deposed King Chu Xin, imprisoned him, and divided his territory into two kingdoms. At this time, Gaozu's sons were young, his brothers few, and moreover not worthy, so he wished to enfeoff kings from the same surname to stabilize the realm. He issued an edict saying: 'General Liu Jia has merit, and I will select clansmen who can be made kings.' All the ministers said: 'Establish Liu Jia as King of Jing, ruling over 52 cities east of the Huai; Gaozu's younger brother Jiao as King of Chu, ruling over 36 cities west of the Huai.' He then established his son Fei as King of Qi. This began the enfeoffment of brothers from the Liu clan.

sentences.zh: 高祖十一年秋，淮南王黥布反，東擊荊。

translations.text: In autumn of Gaozu year 11, King Huainan Ying Bu rebelled and attacked Jing to the east.

sentences.zh: 荊王賈與戰，不勝，走富陵，為布軍所殺。

translations.text: King Jing Jia fought him but was defeated, fled to Fuling, and was killed by Bu's army.

sentences.zh: 高祖自擊破布。

translations.text: Gaozu personally attacked and defeated Bu.

sentences.zh: 十二年，立沛侯劉濞為吳王，王故荊地。

translations.text: In year 12, he established Marquis Pei Liu Pi as King of Wu, ruling over the former Jing territory.

In autumn of Gaozu year 11, King Huainan Ying Bu rebelled and attacked Jing to the east. King Jing Jia fought him but was defeated, fled to Fuling, and was killed by Bu's army. Gaozu personally attacked and defeated Bu. In year 12, he established Marquis Pei Liu Pi as King of Wu, ruling over the former Jing territory.

sentences.zh: 燕王劉澤者，諸劉遠屬也。

translations.text: King Yan Liu Ze was a distant relation of the various Liu clansmen.

sentences.zh: 高帝三年，澤為郎中。

translations.text: In Gaozu year 3, Ze served as a palace attendant.

sentences.zh: 高帝十一年，澤以將軍擊陳豨，得王黃，為營陵侯。

translations.text: In Gaozu year 11, Ze as a general attacked Chen Xi, captured Wang Huang, and was made Marquis of Yingling.

King Yan Liu Ze was a distant relation of the various Liu clansmen. In Gaozu year 3, Ze served as a palace attendant. In Gaozu year 11, Ze as a general attacked Chen Xi, captured Wang Huang, and was made Marquis of Yingling.

sentences.zh: 高后時，齊人田生游乏資，以畫干營陵侯澤。

translations.text: During Empress Gao's time, a man from Qi named Tian Sheng, traveling without funds, sought patronage from Marquis Yingling Ze with his paintings.

sentences.zh: 澤大說之，用金二百斤為田生壽。

translations.text: Ze was greatly pleased with him and used 200 jin of gold to celebrate Tian Sheng's birthday.

sentences.zh: 田生已得金，即歸齊。

translations.text: After Tian Sheng received the gold, he immediately returned to Qi.

sentences.zh: 二年，澤使人謂田生曰：「弗與矣。」

translations.text: Two years later, Ze sent someone to tell Tian Sheng: 'The matter is finished.'

sentences.zh: 田生如長安，不見澤，而假大宅，令其子求事呂后所幸大謁者張子卿。

translations.text: Tian Sheng went to Chang'an but did not see Ze. Instead, he rented a large residence and had his son seek service with Zhang Ziqing, the Grand Usher favored by Empress Lü.

sentences.zh: 居數月，田生子請張卿臨，親修具。

translations.text: After several months, Tian Sheng's son invited Zhang Qing to visit, preparing elaborate arrangements personally.

sentences.zh: 張卿許往。

translations.text: Zhang Qing agreed to go.

sentences.zh: 田生盛帷帳共具，譬如列侯。

translations.text: Tian Sheng prepared lavish curtains and furnishings, comparable to those of marquises.

sentences.zh: 張卿驚。

translations.text: Zhang Qing was astonished.

sentences.zh: 酒酣，乃屏人說張卿曰：「臣觀諸侯王邸弟百餘，皆高祖一切功臣。

translations.text: When the wine flowed freely, he dismissed the attendants and spoke confidentially to Zhang Qing: 'I have observed that the sons and younger brothers of the feudal kings in the various mansions number over a hundred, all of them Gaozu's founding meritorious officials.

sentences.zh: 今呂氏雅故本推轂高帝就天下，功至大，又親戚太后之重。

translations.text: Now the Lü clan, being old acquaintances, originally helped push Gaozu to obtain the realm, their merit is extremely great, and moreover they have the weighty kinship of being the empress dowager's relatives.

sentences.zh: 太后春秋長，諸呂弱，太后欲立呂產為［呂］王，王代。

translations.text: The empress dowager is advanced in years, the various Lü are weak, the empress dowager wishes to establish Lü Chan as king of Lü, ruling Dai.

sentences.zh: 太后又重發之，恐大臣不聽。

translations.text: The empress dowager repeatedly brings this up, fearing the ministers will not listen.

sentences.zh: 今卿最幸，大臣所敬，何不風大臣以聞太后，太后必喜。

translations.text: Now you are most favored, respected by the ministers—why not sound out the ministers to inform the empress dowager? The empress dowager will certainly be pleased.

sentences.zh: 諸呂已王，萬戶侯亦卿之有。

translations.text: Once the various Lü are kings, a marquisate of ten thousand households will also be yours.

sentences.zh: 太后心欲之，而卿為內臣，不急發，恐禍及身矣。」

translations.text: The empress dowager desires this in her heart, and you as an inner minister, if you do not act quickly, disaster may befall you.'

sentences.zh: 張卿大然之，乃風大臣語太后。

translations.text: Zhang Qing greatly approved and began sounding out the ministers to speak to the empress dowager.

sentences.zh: 太后朝，因問大臣。

translations.text: At court, the empress dowager questioned the ministers.

sentences.zh: 大臣請立呂產為呂王。

translations.text: The ministers requested establishing Lü Chan as King of Lü.

sentences.zh: 太后賜張卿千斤金，張卿以其半與田生。

translations.text: The empress dowager granted Zhang Qing a thousand jin of gold, and Zhang Qing gave half of it to Tian Sheng.

sentences.zh: 田生弗受，因說之曰：「呂產王也，諸大臣未大服。

translations.text: Tian Sheng did not accept it, and instead advised him: 'Lü Chan is now king, but the various ministers are not yet greatly convinced.

sentences.zh: 今營陵侯澤，諸劉，為大將軍，獨此尚觖望。

translations.text: Now Marquis Yingling Ze, of the various Liu, serves as Grand General, and only he still feels disappointed.

sentences.zh: 今卿言太后，列十餘縣王之，彼得王，喜去，諸呂王益固矣。」

translations.text: If you speak to the empress dowager now and have her enfeoff him as king of more than ten counties, he will obtain kingship, leave happily, and the various Lü kingships will be even more secure.'

sentences.zh: 張卿入言，太后然之。

translations.text: Zhang Qing went in and spoke, and the empress dowager agreed to it.

sentences.zh: 乃以營陵侯劉澤為瑯邪王。

translations.text: Thus Marquis Yingling Liu Ze was made King of Langye.

sentences.zh: 瑯邪王乃與田生之國。

translations.text: The King of Langye then went to his kingdom with Tian Sheng.

sentences.zh: 田生勸澤急行，毋留。

translations.text: Tian Sheng urged Ze to proceed quickly without delay.

sentences.zh: 出關，太后果使人追止之，已出，即還。

translations.text: They passed through the passes, and the empress dowager indeed sent people to pursue and stop them, but they had already left, so they returned.

During Empress Gao's time, a man from Qi named Tian Sheng, traveling without funds, sought patronage from Marquis Yingling Ze with his paintings. Ze was greatly pleased with him and used 200 jin of gold to celebrate Tian Sheng's birthday. After Tian Sheng received the gold, he immediately returned to Qi. Two years later, Ze sent someone to tell Tian Sheng: 'The matter is finished.' Tian Sheng went to Chang'an but did not see Ze. Instead, he rented a large residence and had his son seek service with Zhang Ziqing, the Grand Usher favored by Empress Lü. After several months, Tian Sheng's son invited Zhang Qing to visit, preparing elaborate arrangements personally. Zhang Qing agreed to go. Tian Sheng prepared lavish curtains and furnishings, comparable to those of marquises. Zhang Qing was astonished. When the wine flowed freely, he dismissed the attendants and spoke confidentially to Zhang Qing: 'I have observed that the sons and younger brothers of the feudal kings in the various mansions number over a hundred, all of them Gaozu's founding meritorious officials. Now the Lü clan, being old acquaintances, originally helped push Gaozu to obtain the realm, their merit is extremely great, and moreover they have the weighty kinship of being the empress dowager's relatives. The empress dowager is advanced in years, the various Lü are weak, the empress dowager wishes to establish Lü Chan as king of Lü, ruling Dai. The empress dowager repeatedly brings this up, fearing the ministers will not listen. Now you are most favored, respected by the ministers—why not sound out the ministers to inform the empress dowager? The empress dowager will certainly be pleased. Once the various Lü are kings, a marquisate of ten thousand households will also be yours. The empress dowager desires this in her heart, and you as an inner minister, if you do not act quickly, disaster may befall you.' Zhang Qing greatly approved and began sounding out the ministers to speak to the empress dowager. At court, the empress dowager questioned the ministers. The ministers requested establishing Lü Chan as King of Lü. The empress dowager granted Zhang Qing a thousand jin of gold, and Zhang Qing gave half of it to Tian Sheng. Tian Sheng did not accept it, and instead advised him: 'Lü Chan is now king, but the various ministers are not yet greatly convinced. Now Marquis Yingling Ze, of the various Liu, serves as Grand General, and only he still feels disappointed. If you speak to the empress dowager now and have her enfeoff him as king of more than ten counties, he will obtain kingship, leave happily, and the various Lü kingships will be even more secure.' Zhang Qing went in and spoke, and the empress dowager agreed to it. Thus Marquis Yingling Liu Ze was made King of Langye. The King of Langye then went to his kingdom with Tian Sheng. Tian Sheng urged Ze to proceed quickly without delay. They passed through the passes, and the empress dowager indeed sent people to pursue and stop them, but they had already left, so they returned.

sentences.zh: 及太后崩，瑯邪王澤乃曰：「帝少，諸呂用事，劉氏孤弱。」

translations.text: When the empress dowager passed away, King Langye Ze said: 'The emperor is young, the various Lü hold power, the Liu clan is isolated and weak.'

sentences.zh: 乃引兵與齊王合謀西，欲誅諸呂。

translations.text: He then led troops west in conspiracy with the King of Qi, wishing to execute the various Lü.

sentences.zh: 至梁，聞漢遣灌將軍屯滎陽，澤還兵備西界，遂跳驅至長安。

translations.text: When they reached Liang, hearing that Han had sent General Guan to garrison Xingyang, Ze returned his troops to defend the western border, then galloped swiftly to Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 代王亦從代至。

translations.text: The King of Dai also arrived from Dai.

sentences.zh: 諸將相與瑯邪王共立代王為天子。

translations.text: The various generals together with the King of Langye commonly established the King of Dai as Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 天子乃徙澤為燕王，乃復以瑯邪予齊，復故地。

translations.text: The Son of Heaven then moved Ze to become King of Yan, and returned Langye to Qi, restoring the old territory.

When the empress dowager passed away, King Langye Ze said: 'The emperor is young, the various Lü hold power, the Liu clan is isolated and weak.' He then led troops west in conspiracy with the King of Qi, wishing to execute the various Lü. When they reached Liang, hearing that Han had sent General Guan to garrison Xingyang, Ze returned his troops to defend the western border, then galloped swiftly to Chang'an. The King of Dai also arrived from Dai. The various generals together with the King of Langye commonly established the King of Dai as Son of Heaven. The Son of Heaven then moved Ze to become King of Yan, and returned Langye to Qi, restoring the old territory.

sentences.zh: 澤王燕二年，薨，謚為敬王。

translations.text: Ze ruled Yan for two years, passed away, and was given the posthumous title King Jing.

sentences.zh: 傳子嘉，為康王。

translations.text: He passed the throne to his son Jia, who became King Kang.
Ze ruled Yan for two years, passed away, and was given the posthumous title King Jing. He passed the throne to his son Jia, who became King Kang.

sentences.zh: 至孫定國，與父康王姬姦，生子男一人。

translations.text: Down to his grandson Dingguo, who committed adultery with his father King Kang's concubine, fathering one son.

sentences.zh: 奪弟妻為姬。

translations.text: He seized his younger brother's wife as a concubine.

sentences.zh: 與子女三人姦。

translations.text: He committed adultery with three daughters.

sentences.zh: 定國有所欲誅殺臣肥如令郢人，郢人等告定國，定國使謁者以他法劾捕格殺郢人以滅口。

translations.text: Dingguo wished to execute a minister Fei, so he ordered the man from Ying to do it. The man from Ying and others informed on Dingguo, so Dingguo ordered the usher to indict and arrest them on other charges, executing them to silence them.

sentences.zh: 至元朔元年，郢人昆弟復上書具言定國陰事，以此發覺。

translations.text: In Yuanshuo year 1, the man from Ying's brothers submitted another memorial fully detailing Dingguo's secret affairs, and thus it was discovered.

sentences.zh: 詔下公卿，皆議曰：「定國禽獸行，亂人倫，逆天，當誅。」

translations.text: The edict was issued to the ministers, and all discussed saying: 'Dingguo's conduct is that of beasts, disrupting human relationships, opposing heaven—he should be executed.'

sentences.zh: 上許之。

translations.text: The emperor approved it.

sentences.zh: 定國自殺，國除為郡。

translations.text: Dingguo committed suicide, and the state was abolished to become a commandery.

Down to his grandson Dingguo, who committed adultery with his father King Kang's concubine, fathering one son. He seized his younger brother's wife as a concubine. He committed adultery with three daughters. Dingguo wished to execute a minister Fei, so he ordered the man from Ying to do it. The man from Ying and others informed on Dingguo, so Dingguo ordered the usher to indict and arrest them on other charges, executing them to silence them. In Yuanshuo year 1, the man from Ying's brothers submitted another memorial fully detailing Dingguo's secret affairs, and thus it was discovered. The edict was issued to the ministers, and all discussed saying: 'Dingguo's conduct is that of beasts, disrupting human relationships, opposing heaven—he should be executed.' The emperor approved it. Dingguo committed suicide, and the state was abolished to become a commandery.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：荊王王也，由漢初定，天下未集，故劉賈雖屬疏，然以策為王，填江淮之閒。

translations.text: The Grand Historian says: King Jing became king because in the early Han, when the realm was not yet settled, thus although Liu Jia was distantly related, he was nevertheless made king through strategy, filling the region between the Jiang and Huai.

sentences.zh: 劉澤之王，權激呂氏，然劉澤卒南面稱孤者三世。

translations.text: Liu Ze's kingship was provoked by the Lü clan's power, yet Liu Ze ultimately faced south and claimed isolation for three generations.

sentences.zh: 事發相重，豈不為偉乎！

translations.text: The events that occurred were significant—how can this not be considered remarkable!

The Grand Historian says: King Jing became king because in the early Han, when the realm was not yet settled, thus although Liu Jia was distantly related, he was nevertheless made king through strategy, filling the region between the Jiang and Huai. Liu Ze's kingship was provoked by the Lü clan's power, yet Liu Ze ultimately faced south and claimed isolation for three generations. The events that occurred were significant—how can this not be considered remarkable!
